CatDescriptText: Mrs. Pearl Cole, house wife, 8087 Clarissa Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 22, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the visit of the Russian ruler, Khrushchev, will promote world peace?" answer reads: "I don't believe that it will because I don't have faith in Russians. They have deceived us so much in the past.  They just talk about doing the right thing, and that's about all it amounts to."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Pearl Cole wearing eyeglasses and striped sleeveless dress with bow, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
